title: Etsy Is Attempting to Solve Its Search Issue, but It May possibly Not Be Adequate What Jim Cramer Thinks
text:
Updated to include comments from Jim Cramer.
NEW YORK (TheStreet) — As a marketplace for crafts and handmade goods, Etsy (ETSY) by definition sells exceptional products that are difficult to sort into the average retail categories.
What category does a vintage Polly Pocket toy fall beneath? Or a bunny-themed egg warmer? These quirky things are complicated for Etsy to categorize and unlikely to surface under the average search created by a buyer. Evaluate that to an e-commerce web-site like Amazon (AMZN – Get Report) , which can much far more readily group goods into uncomplicated-to-navigate categories such as beauty and appliances.
When Etsy very first began out, this was much less of an problem, largely due to the lower volumes of sellers, purchasers and solutions. A decade ago, most of the buyers were sellers themselves and satisfied to take the time sifting by means of unique goods to obtain exactly what they wanted.

&quotThe needs of the niche marketplace we have been in 2005 are really diverse than our requirements today,&quot said Jaime DeLanghe, senior item manager for search at Etsy.
Now with much more than 32 million merchandise, 1.five million active sellers, and 21.7 million active purchasers, coupled with Wall Street’s demand for even much more user growth, Etsy finds the importance of search and discoverability reaching new levels.
Etsy’s stock is down practically 50% because its all-time higher reached at the close of its first day of trading in April and has observed its net losses swell.
&quotMost of our function on search has been focused on making the marketplace extra understandable for people who don’t know what they are hunting for yet,&quot DeLanghe stated.
Take into account someone totally unfamiliar with Etsy checking out the web page — Etsy requirements to make positive that consumer isn’t overwhelmed by the vast quantity of items. One of the key alterations Etsy has made to protect against that from taking place is introducing a new taxonomy of categories that assistance a consumer navigate the web site. Even though the old categories were far more geared to how sellers would describe their items — such as &quotknitted items&quot and &quotmetalwork&quot — the new categories are focused a lot more on what buyers might be thinking about — such as rings, scarves, cat-themed goods, and so on.
This new technique was launched in February and was followed in July by a new feature named Exploratory Search, which takes a broad query and presents subcategories to assistance purchasers better discover relevant products. For instance, if you search for jewelry, you will then be presented with subcategories such as earrings and bracelets. And if you click on earrings, you will then see categories like &quotHoop Earrings&quot and &Quote: ar Jackets &amp Climbers.&quot
These updates were created to make search a lot more intuitive and easy for consumers. According to Etsy, they led to a 10% enhance in search engagement metrics such as listing click-by means of rates.
&quotWe’ve heard from buyers that Etsy can really feel overwhelming. This offers new individuals a far better entry point into the marketplace,&quot said DeLanghe. &quotYou do not have to be an expert to search on Etsy any longer.&quot
